channel.title: Projects on Jens Jonsson Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Jens Jonsson Portfolio

item.title: Current Coursework
item.description: Currently, I am taking a course in applied cryptography and a project course on building a secure network. I will update my website once I have written my reports and documentation. For the applied cryptography course, I have coded an implementation of AES in Rust and completed Set 1 of the Cryptopals challenges. I will also probably add some writeups for some picoCTF forensic flags once I have time.

item.title: Bachelor Degree Project: Password Generation using ambient sound
item.description: My bachelor degree project that investigates if using regular ambient sound can be used to generate secure passwords. In short: it is not great. Using two computers to record audio simultaneously resulted in one computer showing terrible entropy according to the NIST 800-90B test suite, while the other showed great entropy. When using the recorded audio as an entropy source for our underlying hash-based RNG, our RNG passed the NIST 800-22 tests.

item.title: Design of a prototype GUI for Vattenfall
item.description: A report, developed as part of a group project for Vattenfall, exploring and designing a prototype GUI aimed at raising awareness of energy consumption and promoting more sustainable usage practices. Read the report Research and Writing Contributions Eco-feedback Data representation

item.title: Klantboll
item.description: Your browser does not support the video tag. A game made from scratch by a team of 9 students using Scrum. The game is about playing as a clumsy football player and picking up power-ups, but be careful some of them are rigged against you! Kick your way to victory! Coded in C# and created in Unity. Try it out! Github Game Development Responsibilities Kicking functionality Prototype movement Ragdoll functionality Animation switching Acting Product Owner
